ovdesc.p: In Outward clearing process, whenever clearing entries created through front ends like Teller, FT, DC etc, system generates CHEQUE.COLLECTION records for each entry with details of the outward clearing.
These CHEQUE.COLLECTION records can be grouped into a single batch according to requirements.
For processing further on the batches or collection records, like re-batch, selective combination and changing status of records selected from various batches etc., CHEQUE.CHANGE application is used.
By using the application CHEQUE.CHANGE, the following process could be done:

All or selected Cheque Batches can be combined into a single batch. The ID of the new batch created will be displayed by the system. All the cheque collection records of the new batch will bear the new batch ID for future reference.
Cheque collection records or batches meeting a certain selection criteria can be processed further for RE-BATCH, or changing status to CLEARED/ RETURNED
An existing enquiry based on Cheque Collection or Cheque Batch also can be used for selection and further processing
The application is to be used in VERIFY mode.

desc.p: Defines the value of the selected field for picking up the data as per the operand for further processing.
Example:
@ID EQ CCBA0007300012 CCBA000730015 will pick up the two cheque batches with ID as defined above for further process like Re-Batch
Any valid data

Example:
EQ ( Equal to), LK (like), GT (Greater than)
All valid operands are allowed

Defines the operation to be done by the system on the data selected as per selection criteria.
In the case of CHEQUE.COLLECTION records selected based on a criteria, operations like CLEARED, RETURNED and DATE. CHANGE could be done
Permitted operations are CLEARED, RETURNED, RE-BATCH and DATE.CHANGE.
The ID allotted by the system to the new batch generated out of the Re-batch operation
All the Cheque Collection records grouped under the new batch will bear this Rebatch Id as a reference
